name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: they are doing great working feeding people. the only thing of note is that the people who come to get food tend to block the street and pee in public around the establishment. i was sitting in my car at a nearby parking lot and several people came and peed right in front my eyes ü´£usually i love this kind of stuff but in this circumstance it was a littleeee sketchy

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: I come here to eat breakfast once a week and  lunch a couple of times, it was a nice experience.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: They do a meal for the homeless and people struggling. The disappointing part to this place is that they don't allow homeless people access to the toilets/restroom

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text:
This is Clarence Wright and Brandon and Jesus were really great at what they do getting people off the streets of Santa Monica. It was really genuine and I could tell they were going to help me no matter what wether it be getting back home or into a stable living environment.

Props to these 2 gentleman. Thank you all!

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: I do not share their belief in God but if there is such a thing as "The Lord's Work" they are definitely doing it. Thanks for all of the hot meals, clothes and wonderful staff including volunteers!!

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: Beautiful people here. Food given out here.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: These guys are totally rad!!! Enjoy their energy! Not doing anything Thursday night; drop in!

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text:
They have a very good Sunday breakfast, and excellent food for a late dinner, especially on Thursday.

On Tuesday, students from UCLA have lentils and rice. It's fine. It's great when you're really hungry.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: If you are in need of help or looking for an opportunity to volunteer, the team and facility here are incredible! They work around the clock to provide services to the many men and women experiencing homelessness in our city. The leaders Chris and Erin Wikle are extremely hardworking, compassionate and inclusive to all members of our community. They've seen it all during their 3+ years of service here, however, they approach each individual as if for the very first time. They've also worked tirelessly to provide hot meals, hygiene kits, internet access, masks, food deliveries and more to thousands of local residents struggling with food insecurity, job loss and homelessness during the pandemic. They're also lucky to have Noah and Michael who go above and beyond to make the Salvation Army such an amazing place. These folks inspire me to do even more in our neighborhood, so you should definitely check it out.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: So Helpful!

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: So many great things to say about the salvation army. Friendly, kind and wonderful people that work and volunteer here at the SA because they want to give/make a difference with time and leave smiles all around. üëçüëçüëçüíùüíô‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text:
9am they offer food but the line goes extremly slow!! The food will be 2 cans of soup 1 canned tuna and 1 canned chicken and "maybe" a jar of peanut butter.
Keep in mind it's cold soup and no can opener! One time I got a bagel and a orange also. Try it see for yourself. I recommend being there 8:30am first 5 people in line or skip it.

Recommend Going to the OPCC for 9am bagged lunch M-F!!  Some days is better then others...

They have free mail service and showers also. It's not far like 2 blocks or so away from Salvation.
Lunch on Saterday is a microwaved dinner served around 10am. Sunday is usually a good lunch bag. Around 10am (yummy sub, Oreos, bottle watter, peanut butter crackers, fruit)
...
3pm M-F at OPCC is a FREE burger.
NO BURGER on Saterday or Sunday
It takes like 2 hours wait in the sun though not really worth it. First 20 or so in line might get 2nd burger ask though.
It's a cheeseburger at mcdonalds or a cheep-o from Jack in the box.
Sometimes instead of burgers they have other meals probably twice in a week. More then just a burger but usually not as good.
I'd 5 star OPCC
Salvation Army needs better meals and faster lines.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: Great people the cook was on point the preacher lieutenant a beautiful people the Dogtown disciples are always cheerful and happy

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: Good food thurs. Veggie handouts.  Beet soup,tie dyed my socks.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: I love it! Switching over from Pastor "so-called nothing but a joke bills" church, to this one is WAY MORE RESPECTABLE, FRIENDLY, AND MOST OF ALL, FUN FOR EVERYONE INVOLVED!! I am SO glad I switched! It's the best decision I ever made! Besides, Pastor Bill I found out has NEVER BEEN a true pastor from the start! He admitted that to me the moment I asked him about it, and he never denied it either! That's why he admitted not only to me, but to several others about it the last time I saw him!

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text: Quick, Easy, and to the point. Very spacious with lots of options.

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text:
Just a free tip; Salvation Army procedure is to run adrug / work program but they must have you promise that your income is Zero
And then they allow you into the program... drug use or dependance is not required. Any claim of income like food stamps will disqulify you

name: The Salvation Army Santa Monica
review_text:
Salvation Army is the most transparent not for profit organization in the world, truly existing to meet the needs of homeless children adults, and families. Rehabilitation services for both men and women, of which most of the funds made from sales at thrift stores goes to. Also assisting the elderly with housing, those who would be homeless otherwise. Disaster relief and shelters, all without making a point to brag to the world about helping in these ways and more. They are truly deserving of any time or resources people can donate. I sponsored the Salvation Army in my region with free
advertising, bulding awareness in the community as well as a food drive.
